instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: IVAGO. Summary: Professional Competence Training (Code 95). Description: To work as a driver at IVAGO, employees must be in possession of a C or CE driver's license with professional competence. This driving license has a limited period of validity. In order for the driver's license to remain valid, 35 hours of additional training must be completed in cycles of 5 years (or 7 hours per year). This training can only be provided by training institutions that have the necessary recognition - the training modules must also be recognized. For this, reference can be made to the applicable regulations: * https://mobilit.belgium.be/nl/weg/rijder/rijbeleggen/belgisch-rijbestrijding/vak competentheid#paragraph-anchor-1 IVAGO offers the training courses and seeks cooperation with a recognized training institution. For operational reasons it is appropriate to organize one training session per year in Q1. The trainer must be a recognized institution in the context of organizing the training type 'code95'. The tenderer must also provide the necessary administration to the Federal Department of Mobility and have sufficient modules to make a choice.<br> Category (CPV code): Driving test services (80411100). Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: IVAGO
output.Summary: Professional Competence Training (Code 95)

This training can only be provided by training institutions that have the necessary recognition - the training modules must also be recognized. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR SICKNESS AND DISABILITY INSURANCE. Summary: Competition Procedure with Negotiation Regarding Multimedia Infrastructure, Maintenance and Audiovisual Support in the Context of Events. Description: This public contract concerns the framework agreement for multimedia infrastructure and audiovisual support for the buildings of the contracting authority. The contract is divided into two lots: Lot 1 Supply, installation, training and maintenance of multimedia infrastructure This plot concerns the purchase of new multimedia infrastructure and associated services. On the one hand, it includes the supply of audiovisual equipment on the basis of a product catalogue, in which tenderers must quote a price per product (the so-called "Quoted Products"). In addition the parcel includes support services, including: the coordination, installation and configuration of the infrastructure provided, training for users, technicians and administrators, and the maintenance of both the newly purchased and the existing multimedia infrastructure. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: VLAAMSE VERENIGING VOOR ONTWIKKELINGSSAMENWERKING EN TECHNISCHE BIJSTAND. Summary: Framework Agreement for Evaluation of the Leaders in Teaching Tanzania Programme - Lead Pillar 2025 -2030 for Vvob Tanzania, Consisting of Three Measurements (Baseline, Midline, Endline). Description: This framework contract agreement foresees in four assignments with one contractor of which the first will be awarded immediately, the second, third and fourth will be ordered at the contracting authority-s convenience : -Baseline evaluation (first assignment) -(Re)development of tools & testing -Midline evaluation -Endline evaluation This call for quotations already includes terms of references for the baseline evaluation (see annex 1 ). For the other assignments, specific terms of reference will be developed and shared with the pre-qualified contractor. Based on the Terms of Reference, the consultant will submit a short proposal. If approved, VVOB will appoint the contractor to carry out the evaluation, adhering to the general conditions set out in the framework contract and the specific requirements of the assignment. Through these evaluations, VVOB aims to learn about and get an external appreciation of its programme and main objective: “Do school leaders build a supportive environment for the professional development of teaching staff and how? How does/did the programme contribute to this? And how can implementation be improved to enhance effectiveness, impact and sustainability? ” <br> Doc Title: Framework agreement for evaluation of the Leaders in Teaching Tanzania programme - LEAD pillar 2025 -2030 for VVOB Tanzania, consisting of three measurements (baseline, midline, endline) <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EIT DIGITAL IVZW. Summary: Training Development Services in Ai and Data Science for National Competition Authorities in Eu Member States. Description: EIT Digital seeks a Contractor that cooperates with EIT Digital to create, develop and deliver training plans for National Competition Authorities (NCA). In the field of Law enforcement, the National Competition Authorities (NCA) face growing challenges due to evolving digital markets, platform dynamics, data-driven business models, and algorithmic pricing. The goal is to equip the NCAs with the capacity to address competition issues in the digital economy using modern tools (AI, data science), methodologies, and a shared knowledge base. The purpose of this assignment is to develop a training programme that enables NCAs to effectively address anti-competitive behaviour. The Contractor will design and deliver training sessions through multiple formats including asynchronous e-learning modules and hands-on labs (face-to-face or online). To further knowledge transfer, the contractor will also develop a Train the Trainer programme to prepare selected points of contact to serve as internal trainers within each NCA. Through this procedure, EIT Digital aims to identify a suitable Contractor with proven expertise in capacity building in digital science, AI and competition law enforcement. <br> Doc Title: Training Development Services in AI and Data Science for National Competition Authorities in EU Member States <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 700000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-08-29. Closing Date: 2025-10-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: EIT DIGITAL IVZW
output.Summary: Training Development Services in Ai and Data Science for National Competition Authorities in Eu Member States

In the field of Law enforcement, the National Competition Authorities (NCA) face growing challenges due to evolving digital markets, platform dynamics, data-driven business models, and algorithmic pricing. The goal is to equip the NCAs with the capacity to address competition issues in the digital economy using modern tools (AI, data science), methodologies, and a shared knowledge base. The purpose of this assignment is to develop a training programme that enables NCAs to effectively address anti-competitive behaviour. The Contractor will design and deliver training sessions through multiple formats including asynchronous e-learning modules and hands-on labs (face-to-face or online). To further knowledge transfer, the contractor will also develop a Train the Trainer programme to prepare selected points of contact to serve as internal trainers within each NCA. Through this procedure, EIT Digital aims to identify a suitable Contractor with proven expertise in capacity building in digital science, AI and competition law enforcement. <br> Doc Title: Training Development Services in AI and Data Science for National Competition Authorities in EU Member States <br> Contract Type: services

Summary: Keeping a Theoretical and Practical First Aid Training Operational in the Context of the Reform of the Category B Driving License. Description: The present assignment concerns the continuation of the mandatory first aid training for obtaining a driver's license in the Brussels-Capital Region.<br> The intended training consists of two parts, one theoretical and the other practical.<br> The theoretical training must the candidates the possibility Bidding to learn the theory of first aid with regard to traffic accidents. This first part must be able to be followed remotely via a computer platform, made and set up in the context of this assignment. In addition, suitable buildings must also be made available to the Candidates by the service provider, equipped with computers allowing to follow this training. The content of the theoretical training is also determined by the tenderers on the basis of the minimum requirements laid down in the technical provisions of the assignment documents.<br> The practical Training consists of half online course and the other half in "person" (physical), according to modalities that must be determined by the service provider in accordance with the technical provisions set out below.<br> At the end of theoretical and practical training the service provider provides the issue of a document that confirms that a candidate has attended this training, as well as in the registration in the central hub (DB exam results). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Capacity Building of Consumer Organizations to Empower Consumer Protection Professionals. Description: The general objective of this call for tenders is to develop an effective approach to capacity building of consumer organizations and provide trainings to participating countries' consumer organizations and other stakeholders active in consumer policy at Union, national, regional and local level. Consumer organizations play a pivotal role in representing consumer needs, protecting their rights, in offering advice, support and education, and in shaping the policy agenda around the Union. Improving consumer policy development calls for intensive and skilled input from end-users and consumers (for example in task forces, advisory groups) thus, consumer representatives are expected to have specific and targeted knowledge. This in turn calls for focused and specialist training of those representing the interests of European consumers. Following the good uptake of the training and a high level of satisfaction expressed by the participants of the Consumer PRO 2019-2023 project, the European Commission decided to continue a similar capacity building of consumer organization project by publishing a new call. The aim of the new project will be to ensure some continuation of the previous Consumer PRO while taking advantage of its outcomes and lessons learned. <br> Doc Title: Capacity building of consumer organizations to empower consumer protection professionals <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 2000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-08-04. Closing Date: 2025-09-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

Improving consumer policy development calls for intensive and skilled input from end-users and consumers (for example in task forces, advisory groups) thus, consumer representatives are expected to have specific and targeted knowledge. This in turn calls for focused and specialist training of those representing the interests of European consumers. Following the good uptake of the training and a high level of satisfaction expressed by the participants of the Consumer PRO 2019-2023 project, the European Commission decided to continue a similar capacity building of consumer organization project by publishing a new call. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, FPI - SERVICE FOR FOREIGN POLICY INSTRUMENTS. Summary: Election Observation and Democratic Support Iv. Description: The purposes of this contract are as follows: • Support the continued development of EU election observation methodology in line with relevant international standards of democratic elections and improving effective follow-up of the recommendations made by EU electoral missions. • Support high quality and consistency of EU electoral missions reporting and communication products and the enhancement of public outreach/visibility/awareness raising and understanding (through traditional and new channels of communication) of EU electoral missions both in the country of the mission and in the EU press and institutions. • Contribute to assessing how new features or challenges to election observation such as hybrid threats, disinformation, information manipulation and the use of artificial intelligence impact election observation methodology and how they can be addressed. • Provide methodological support to members of EU election missions, to ensure an uniform application of existing methodology and training to potential members of EU election missions, to expand the pool of qualified candidates. • Support optimising EU electoral missions- operational procedures. <br> Doc Title: Election Observation and Democratic Support IV <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 6000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-07-29. Closing Date: 2025-08-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

Description: The selected Course Leader will be responsible for: Programme Development · Designing a modular, professional-level curriculum (in-person, online, or hybrid) aligned with the following overarching objectives: · Critically examine systemic vulnerabilities in UAE food systems. · Foster collaboration across government, private, and research sectors. · Build food systems literacy among decision-makers and emerging leaders. · Advance knowledge and application of agritech and data-driven agriculture. · Identify and scale innovative practices and capabilities. Programme Delivery · Leading the delivery of the course in collaboration with selected experts and guest lecturers. · Facilitating interactive, challenge-based components (e.g., workshops, simulations, scenario planning). · Incorporating case studies and applied projects relevant to UAE and comparable international contexts. Expert Engagement Identifying, inviting, and integrating global and local subject matter experts across the domains of: · Food security policy and economics · Agritech and climate-resilient agriculture · Data analytics and agricultural informatics · Supply chain logistics and critical infrastructure · Community and ecosystem resilience Evaluation and Iteration · Designing tools to assess learning outcomes and participant engagement. · Iteratively refining content based on participant feedback and contextual shifts. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HAUTE ECOLE ALBERT JACQUARD(3P). Summary: Entrepreneurship Training Service for Student Entrepreneurs. Description: The Haute Ecole Albert Jacquard wishes to constitute a team of trainers in the context of awareness of the spirit of undertaking within its institution to offer training to its students, all departments combined (educational, paramedical, economic, industriescreative and digital), during different evenings during the academic year 2025-26. The organization of these training days is possible thanks to the partnership with Wallonia Entreprendre. The first training session of the academic year will take place on Mondays, Tuesdays and/or ThursdaysSoirs (6 p.m. to 9 p.m.) (Stress/self -confidence management modules may possibly be offered during the day) between October and December - the second session will take place from February to April. benefitof an initiation to entrepreneurship and can be equipped to develop an entrepreneurial project (independently or by being incubated). Summary: Enhancing Animal Health and Welfare in Eu Member States and Candidate Countries: Harmonizing Eu Legal Frameworks through the 'Better Training for Safer Food' Initiative. Description: The subject of this call for tenders is the organisation and implementation of training activities on Animal Health and Animal Welfare Law under the "Better Training for Safer Food" initiative. The execution of the tasks will be divided in two separate phases of 30 months each. The main objectives of this call for tender are: Protecting the EU from animal diseases, harmonizing EU legislation, promoting sustainable food systems, supporting DG SANTE priorities and enhancing global recognition of EU standards. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT, COMM - DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR COMMUNICATION. Summary: Implementation of the European Parliament Training Programme for Young European Journalists in France.. Description: The overarching service required is the organisation and implementation of a training programme on EU issues, with the purpose of raising awareness of young journalists, working for EU-based media outlets, regarding European affairs in general and Parliament-related topics in particular. The training programme aims at contributing to a better understanding of how the EU works, and at raising awareness about the importance of the Parliament, parliamentary democracy, as well as the values it stands for. It will include a module in Paris (or in another city in France) once or twice per year (first module), followed by a module in Brussels or Strasbourg (second module) for a limited number of journalists selected among participants in the first module. The target of this training are professionals in the beginning of their journalistic career, based in EU member states, in their capacity as key multipliers and informed relays. The following specific services should be included in the contractor-s offer: •Organisation of the programme (first module); •Selection of participants (first and second modules); •Communication and outreach activities. <br> Doc Title: Implementation of the European Parliament Training Programme for young European journalists in France. <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-04-08. Closing Date: 2025-05-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT, COMM - DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR COMMUNICATION

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN EXTERNAL ACTION SERVICE (EEAS). Summary: Hostile Environment Awareness Training (Heat). Description: The European Union demands its staff to execute missions outside their place of employment or to be based in EU Delegations in order to execute its mandate. The destinations of these missions and the places of the EU Delegations cover over 145 countries around the world including countries considered as being of high or critical threat level. Due to the inherent and increased security risks in these countries and in order to fulfil their respective duty of care responsibilities, the following institutions and bodies launch this tender for providing Hostile Environment Awareness Training (HEAT) for their staff. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: THE GENERAL SECRETARIAT OF THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION. Summary: Uca 24/064 Training in Tactical Emergency Casualty Care. Description: The General Secretariat of the Council is launching a call for tenders for the conclusion of a framework contract in cascade with three economic operators for a four-year duration. The objective of this call for tenders is to facilitate Tactical Emergency Casualty Care (TECC) training for its internal operational security staff. The following is a non-exhaustive list of the training courses which must be provided: •A fundamental theoretical and practical course (Basic course), over 2 days, designed to acquire the required knowledge and competencies in TECC. Upon successful completion, participants will receive a certificate of completion. •A refresher course, with a minimum duration of eight hours, designed to reinforce knowledge and confidence, re-train for TECC situations. Upon successful completion, participants will receive a certificate of completion. The TECC training to be delivered should align with the skill set required for law enforcement officers who may already have basic first aid training as specified in the guidelines of the Committee for Tactical Emergency Casualty Care (C-TECC ). The goal is to ensure that participants possess the knowledge and skills required for the field, and upon successful completion of the training, they will receive a certificate of their competence in TECC principles and practices. <br> Doc Title: UCA 24/064 Training in tactical emergency casualty care <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-02-28. Closing Date: 2025-04-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

output.Purchaser_Name: THE GENERAL SECRETARIAT OF THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: ECOLE D'ADMINISTRATION PUBLQIUE. Summary: Public Market of Services Relating to Training in "web Accessibility" - 3rd Recovery. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN DEFENCE AGENCY. Summary: Service Framework Contract for the Provision of a Proof of Concept on Integration of Ai in M&S Enabled Wargaming (24.Rti.Op.202). Description: The domain selected for the 2024 Proof-of-Concept under HEDI is the Digital domain with a specific focus the exploration of the role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in modelling and simulation (M&S) enabled wargaming (WG). M&S-enabled WG provides significant advantages to military end-users by creating realistic and controlled environments in which to test and refine strategies without the risks and costs associated with live training exercises. Additionally, wargaming facilitates the evaluation of new tactics and technologies, enabling military operators to adapt to evolving warfare landscapes swiftly. The ability to replicate diverse combat situations and iterate through multiple scenarios ensures that personnel are well-versed in handling a wide range of contingencies, ultimately leading to improved mission success rates and reduced casualties. The integration of AI into M&S-enabled WG could bring transformative benefits. AI enhances the realism and complexity of simulated environments by generating dynamic and adaptive threat scenarios that evolve based on the actions of the participants. This capability ensures that military operators face unpredictable and challenging situations, closely mimicking real-world conditions. AI-driven simulations can analyse vast amounts of data in real-time, providing immediate feedback and strategic recommendations, which significantly enhances the learning experience. Furthermore, AI facilitates advanced data analytics, offering deeper in.... Tender Value: 1300000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-10-08. Closing Date: 2024-11-11. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Defence Agency (EDA)

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: TOURISM EAST FLANDERS VZW. Summary: Ambassador Trajectory Tourism East Flanders. Description: Tourism East Flanders has had an ambassador trajectory since 2019, in which tourist entrepreneurs can become "ambassador" of their area (Meetjesland, Waasland, Flemish Ardennes, Scheldeland). The focus was on a tourist reception from the start by focusing on professional hostmanship and an extensive streaking knowledge of the area in question. We have somewhat commemorated the formula. Now we are looking for a partner who can support us in the field of basic courses and the returns in the various areas. The partner acts as the facilitator of the processes, not as its face. That role is reserved for the various area coordinators of Tourism East Flanders. The courses must be compiled by means of Participative and co-creative techniques and offering a mix of theory and practice. <br> Type: Services <br> Training Program Services (80521000). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG REGIO - REGIONAL AND URBAN POLICY. Summary: Capacity-Building for the Implementation of Interreg and Cohesion Policy (2024Ce160at081). Description: The object of this contract is hence to complement general training and capacity-building activities financed by the Commission in the framework of the Instrument for Pre-accession Assistance (IPA) and Global Europe: Neighbourhood, Development and International Cooperation Instrument (GE/NDICI). However, it will focus on the specific needs required to implement EU cohesion policy. The purpose of this call is to select a contractor that will provide short term support to four candidate countries (Albania, Moldova, North Macedonia and Ukraine) to build their administrative capacity necessary to participate in EU cohesion policy programmes in the run-up to accession and implement them upon accession. This will be done by delivering hands-on training sessions on substance and organising short-term study visits for targeted staff of national and/or regional and local authorities in the four countries. <br> Doc Title: Capacity-building for the Implementation of Interreg and Cohesion Policy (2024CE160AT081) <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 500000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-08-22. Closing Date: 2024-09-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG HR - HUMAN RESOURCES AND SECURITY. Summary: Prevention of Psychosocial Risks at Work: Awareness Raising Sessions for Managers. Description: Within the European Commission-s Directorate-General Human Resources and Security, Unit HR.D7 is responsible for establishing the policy on the prevention of psychosocial risks (PSR) at work, aiming to establish a structured approach to raise awareness and to equip staff with the right tools to strengthen their resilience. Raising awareness amongst managers plays an essential role in the above approach, given that they would be the first ones to be confronted with a situation that may involve PSR of staff, whether directly or indirectly. This action reflects the Commission-s duty of care, on the one hand, and fulfils the obligations deriving from the applicable provisions and legislation , on the other. The purpose of the new framework contract is therefore to: •prepare and provide tailor-made awareness-raising sessions to managers / staff with a managerial role from specific Directorates General (DGs) and Services, upon their request, concerning the prevention of PSR at work and to promote the mental well-being of staff; •report about any feedback derived from these sessions and possibly recommend preventive follow-up measures in connection to PSR within the concerned DG or Service. <br> Doc Title: Prevention of psychosocial risks at work: Awareness raising sessions for managers <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 370000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-07-11. Closing Date: 2024-09-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG HR - HUMAN RESOURCES AND SECURITY
output.Summary: Prevention of Psychosocial Risks at Work: Awareness Raising Sessions for Managers
output.Description: Within the European Commission-s Directorate-General Human Resources and Security, Unit HR.D7 is responsible for establishing the policy on the prevention of psychosocial risks (PSR) at work, aiming to establish a structured approach to raise awareness and to equip staff with the right tools to strengthen their resilience. Raising awareness amongst managers plays an essential role in the above approach, given that they would be the first ones to be confronted with a situation that may involve PSR of staff, whether directly or indirectly. This action reflects the Commission-s duty of care, on the one hand, and fulfils the obligations deriving from the applicable provisions and legislation , on the other. The purpose of the new framework contract is therefore to: •prepare and provide tailor-made awareness-raising sessions to managers / staff with a managerial role from specific Directorates General (DGs) and Services, upon their request, concerning the prevention of PSR at work and to promote the mental well-being of staff; •report about any feedback derived from these sessions and possibly recommend preventive follow-up measures in connection to PSR within the concerned DG or Service. <br> Doc Title: Prevention of psychosocial risks at work: Awareness raising sessions for managers <br> Contract Type: services

Description: The object of this contract is hence to complement general training and capacity-building activities financed by the Commission in the framework of the Instrument for Pre-accession Assistance (IPA) and Global Europe: Neighbourhood, Development and International Cooperation Instrument (GE/NDICI). However, it will focus on the specific needs required to implement EU cohesion policy. The purpose of this call is to select a contractor that will provide short term support to four candidate countries (Albania, Moldova, North Macedonia and Ukraine) to build their administrative capacity necessary to participate in EU cohesion policy programmes in the run-up to accession and implement them upon accession. This will be done by delivering hands-on training sessions on substance and organising short-term study visits for targeted staff of national and/or regional and local authorities in the four countries. <br> Doc Title: Capacity-building for the Implementation of Interreg and Cohesion Policy (2024CE160AT081) <br> Contract Type: services. Description: This pilot project will deliver live trainings on the use of EU space data for disaster management in 4 locations within EU, via webinars and in bilateral discussions with MS. It will also organize and lead simulation exercises demonstrating the combined used of EU space data and services in crisis situations. Finally, it will be used to assist MS integrate the new Galileo-based alert service in national alert systems. The project has also a component of desktop research and reports drafting on specific questions asked by the contracting authority. <br> Doc Title: Pilot project EU space data and services in support of the EU disaster resilience goals <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG EAC - EDUCATION, YOUTH, SPORT AND CULTURE. Summary: Innovative and Entrepreneurial Higher Education Institutions: further Development of Heinnovate. Description: HEInnovate is a joint initiative of the European Commission and OECD to support individual higher education institutions and higher education systems to assess and develop their innovative and entrepreneurial potential. HEInnovate provides a self-assessment tool for Higher Education Institutions who wish to explore their innovative and entrepreneurial potential. It guides users through a process of identification, prioritisation and action planning in eight key dimensions. HEInnovate also identifies areas of strengths and weaknesses, opens up discussion and debate on the entrepreneurial/innovative nature of the respective institution and it allows to track evolution over time. The tool provides instant access to the results of the self-evaluation, learning materials and a community of users. So far, more than 1.800 HEIs have used the tool online and more than 30.000 assessments have been carried out. The first version of the website was launched in November 2013. A 2.0 version was launched in June 2023 with updated statements and action cards to help HEIs design action plans as a follow-up to their self-assessments. HEInnovate is however more complex than just being an online tool. It develops training materials and manages a group of experts to deliver workshops and trainings to Higher Education staff. It also collects user stories, proposes case studies and organises monthly webinars. HEInnovate therefore needs expertise in the field of entrepreneurship education and is the.... Tender Value: 2200000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-06-10. Closing Date: 2024-08-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG EAC - EDUCATION, YOUTH, SPORT AND CULTURE
output.Summary: Innovative and Entrepreneurial Higher Education Institutions: further Development of Heinnovate

HEInnovate provides a self-assessment tool for Higher Education Institutions who wish to explore their innovative and entrepreneurial potential. HEInnovate also identifies areas of strengths and weaknesses, opens up discussion and debate on the entrepreneurial/innovative nature of the respective institution and it allows to track evolution over time. The tool provides instant access to the results of the self-evaluation, learning materials and a community of users. So far, more than 1.800 HEIs have used the tool online and more than 30.000 assessments have been carried out. The first version of the website was launched in November 2013. A 2.0 version was launched in June 2023 with updated statements and action cards to help HEIs design action plans as a follow-up to their self-assessments. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA) , HADEA - HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Single Framework Contract to Consolidate and Uphold the Operation of the European Digital Skills and Jobs Platform. Description: The objective of this tender is to consolidate and uphold the operation of the Digital Skills and Jobs Platform, including corrective and adaptive maintenance. This tender will also sustain and extend the activities related to the Digital Skills and Jobs Coalition, notably by further supporting collaboration among National Coalitions and the digital skills community in Europe, as well as deepening the exchange between the National Coalition websites and the core Platform. This topic aims to further increase the number of National Coalitions, to get existing and new National Coalitions to be more active and engaged, and to increase the number of members of the Digital Skills and Jobs Coalition. Events, communication campaigns and other activities should be foreseen to raise awareness of the need to close the digital skills gap in the EU and mobilise the community of relevant stakeholders. <br> Doc Title: SINGLE FRAMEWORK CONTRACT TO CONSOLIDATE AND UPHOLD THE OPERATION OF THE EUROPEAN DIGITAL SKILLS AND JOBS PLATFORM <br> Contract Type: services. Team supervision by an external third party constitutes a privileged space-time for discussing questions regarding field work as a team. Thus, the workersrs have a place to express their questions about work, the difficulties they may encounter but also to share what is going well. Supervision then constitutes a moment of sharing which promotes team cohesion and reduces the feeling of loneliness and isolation that thefield worker can sometimes feel. This support can concern both work questions and more organizational questions. <br> 2024-08 - 1<br> Lot 1: Prince de Liege Project<br> The supervision will propose working on clinical situations focused on psychological situationso-medical-social issues encountered by the PMS team. This will involve addressing the difficulties and blockages encountered in the context of PMS support in order to identify possible solutions and thus unblock certain follow-ups and/or approach them from a different angle. PMS monitoring is carried out regularlyurgently, tinged with an emotional component, making certain decisions difficult for the team to accept, including certain decisions about the end of accommodation. This approach will make it possible to create a space for discussion about specific situations and to fuel reflection..... Published Date: 2024-03-14. Closing Date: 2024-04-15. Competition: ICB. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA) , HADEA - HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Organisation and Implementation of Online Training Activities on the Legal Framework, Deployment, Functioning and Future Development of Myhealth@Eu (Ehdsi). Description: The subject of this call for tenders is to organise and implement trainings for the MyHealth@EU (eHealth Digital Service Infrastructure, eHDSI) on the legal framework, deployment, functioning and future development of the MyHealth@EU infrastructure. The main objectives of this service contract is to develop and maintain up to date: (i) the training material to execute the real-time online training sessions, (ii) an online course for individual learning based on the training material used for the real-time online training sessions, and (iii) the eLearning materials on the legal framework, deployment, functioning and future development of MyHealth@EU for the Foundation, as well as the Practitioner Level. The training programme and eLearning materials are essential tools to improve knowledge-transfer and raise awareness on MyHealth@EU, as well as to promote a harmonised approach to the deployment and operation of National Contact Points for eHealth (NCPeH). <br> Doc Title: Organisation and implementation of online training activities on the legal framework, deployment, functioning and future development of MyHealth@EU (eHDSI) <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA) , HADEA - HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: European Digital Skills and Jobs Platform - 2. Description: The objective of this tender is to consolidate and uphold the operation of the Digital Skills and Jobs Platform, including corrective and adaptive maintenance. This tender will also sustain and extend the activities related to the Digital Skills and Jobs Coalition, notably by further supporting collaboration among National Coalitions and the digital skills community in Europe, as well as deepening the exchange between the National Coalition websites and the core Platform. This topic aims to further increase the number of National Coalitions, to get existing and new National Coalitions to be more active and engaged, and to increase the number of members of the Digital Skills and Jobs Coalition. Events, communication campaigns and other activities should be foreseen to raise awareness of the need to close the digital skills gap in the EU and mobilise the community of relevant stakeholders. <br> Doc Title: EUROPEAN DIGITAL SKILLS AND JOBS PLATFORM - 2 <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA) , HADEA - HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Organisation and Implementation of Online Training Activities on the Legal Framework, Deployment, Functioning and Future Development of Myhealth@Eu (Ehdsi). Description: The subject of this call for tenders is to organise and implement trainings for the MyHealth@EU (eHealth Digital Service Infrastructure, eHDSI) on the legal framework, deployment, functioning and future development of the MyHealth@EU infrastructure. The main objectives of this service contract is to develop: (i) the training material to execute the real-time online training sessions, (ii) an online course for individual learning based on the training material used for the real-time online training sessions, and (iii) the eLearning materials on the legal framework, deployment, functioning and future development of MyHealth@EU for the Foundation, as well as the Practitioner Level. The training programme and eLearning materials are essential tools to improve knowledge-transfer and raise awareness on MyHealth@EU, as well as to promote a harmonised approach to the deployment and operation of National Contact Points for eHealth (NCPeH). <br> Doc Title: Organisation and implementation of online training activities on the legal framework, deployment, functioning and future development of MyHealth@EU (eHDSI) <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 500000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-01-26. Closing Date: 2025-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN EDUCATION AND CULTURE EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EACEA) , EACEA - EUROPEAN EDUCATION AND CULTURE EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Stakeholders Engagement and Community Management. Description: A new procurement procedure will be launched by EACEA for the establishment of a Framework Contract on stakeholders- engagement and community management, to ensure the continuous availability of the services and sustain cooperation with stakeholders- groups and the governance of these initiatives. This action will contribute to an effective implementation of communities in the field of education, training, youth and sport such as the one for Electronic Platform for Adult Learning in Europe (EPALE), the one related to European School Education Platform (including eTwinning), the European Digital Education Hub, the Digital Education Hackathon, the one linked to the European Student Card Initiative (ESCI), the Online Language Support (OLS), etc. The objective of this call for tender is the “Provision of services to support Community management in the fields of the Erasmus+ Programme”. The expertise Framework Contract will be concluded with an indicative total budget of maximum 50 000 000 EUR for the 4 years of implementation and will include services such as support for community engagement with a wide diversity of stakeholders, communication and editorial activities, audiovisual and printed materials, digital outreach (websites, platforms and other digital applications), organisation of online and onsite events, knowledge building and/or professional development activities, etc. <br> Doc Title: Stakeholders engagement and community management <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 50000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2024-01-23. Closing Date: 2025-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

Summary: Building Capacity and Knowledge for the Implementation of the Eu Health Technology Assessment Regulation. Description: Through this procedure the contracting authority is seeking to purchase training services in the field of Health Technology Assessment (HTA), to ensure HTA agencies consolidate their knowledge and experience on joint HTA work. This purchase of services comes in a timely matter as the new HTA Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2021/2282) will enter into force in January 2025. The trainings requested will be of different nature, with online classes, recorded modules and follow-up. The topics have been pre-identified by the contracting authority but could be amended based on the actual needs of the HTA agencies and will serve the purpose of further strengthening the understanding of the new HTA Regulations and its provisions. The topic is part of the EU4Health Annual Work Programme 2023. <br> Doc Title: Building capacity and knowledge for the implementation of the EU Health Technology Assessment Regulation <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA) , HADEA - HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Capacity Building to Support the Uptake of Biosimilars in a Multistakeholder Approach. Description: Biosimilar medicines have a similar efficacy and safety compared with their reference medicines and hold the potential to achieve significant savings for health systems and improve access to medicines for patients. Still, barriers remain and impede their successful entry into the market and uptake by health systems. This call for tenders aims to support national authorities in implementing policies and practices that improve biosimilar competition, as a means to contribute to the accessibility, affordability and availability of medicines for patients in the EU. It will do so by proposing a series of capacity-building activities, based on best-practices and recommendations drawn from an analysis of current national biosimilar policies and their impact on savings and access. <br> Doc Title: Capacity building to support the uptake of biosimilars in a multistakeholder approach <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 1500000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2023-12-11. Closing Date: 2024-02-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA) , HADEA - HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG HR - HUMAN RESOURCES AND SECURITY. Summary: Prevention of Psychosocial Risks at Work: Awareness Raising for Managers, Risk Identification and Analysis 2024 - 2028. Description: Within the European Commission-s Directorate-General Human Resources and Security, Unit HR.D.7 is responsible for establishing the policy on prevention of psychosocial risks (PSR) at work. The aim is to use a structured approach to raise awareness, identify, analyse, and prevent such risks. Managers at the Commission often come across situations that may involve PSR of staff, whether directly or indirectly. In this context, an awareness raising training for managers plays an essential role. It reflects the Commission-s duty of care and fulfils the obligations deriving from the applicable provisions and legislation. The purpose of the new contract is therefore •to identify and analyse PSR at work in the Commission; •to prepare and provide an awareness-raising training to managers at the Commission concerning the prevention of PSR at work and to promote the mental well-being of staff; •to propose preventive measures pertaining to PSR within the Commission-s services. <br> Doc Title: Prevention of psychosocial risks at work: Awareness raising for managers, risk identification and analysis 2024 - 2028 <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 390000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2023-11-23. Closing Date: 2024-01-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG HR - HUMAN RESOURCES AND SECURITY
output.Summary: Prevention of Psychosocial Risks at Work: Awareness Raising for Managers, Risk Identification and Analysis 2024 - 2028

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CENTER IFAPME LIEGE-HUY-VERVIERS ASBL. Summary: Development of a Continuing Training Management Tool. Description: The IFAPME Liege-Huy-Verviers Center (CILHV) asbl intends to entrust a service provider with the development of a continuing training management tool. This application must meet the need for integration of information related to customers (registrations, invoices, payments, etc.), trainers(schedules, contracts, etc.), the database of organized training, the management of premises. The software must also take into account its environment and therefore its links with different programs: the Continuing Education website, the Bob accounting software, the non-profit intranet, eetc. This management tool concerns nearly 25 internal users. Finally, it will be appropriate to plan for upgrades and updates.<br> CSCH/CILHV/2023/18 - bis - 1<br> Doc Title: Development of a continuing training management tool<br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2023-11-17. Closing Date: 2023-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: CENTER IFAPME LIEGE-HUY-VERVIERS ASBL
output.Summary: Development of a Continuing Training Management Tool

This application must meet the need for integration of information related to customers (registrations, invoices, payments, etc.), trainers(schedules, contracts, etc.), the database of organized training, the management of premises. The software must also take into account its environment and therefore its links with different programs: the Continuing Education website, the Bob accounting software, the non-profit intranet, eetc. This management tool concerns nearly 25 internal users. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN UNION, REPRESENTED BY THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION. Summary: Outreach to and Engagement with Young People in Eu External Action. Description: Support to increase the impact and sustainability of outreach to and engagement with young people in EU External Action. Tasks include (but are not limited to) curating information on opportunities for young people in external action, supporting young people in benefiting from these opportunities (e.g., through online learning activities or peer exchanges) and developing engaging actions (e.g., consultations, training, identification of programs). The consultant would also support community management, and create and implement a strategy for engagement with alumni. <br> Doc Title: Other community, social and personal services <br> Contract Type: Services. Tender Value: 3000000.00. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2023-10-04. Closing Date: 2024-10-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN EDUCATION AND CULTURE EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EACEA), EACEA.A.4.001 - INTERNATIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING. Summary: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks. Description: The object of this call for tenders is to support to the International Erasmus+ Alumni networks under the format of a framework contract with an indicative total budget of maximum EUR 15 000 000 for 4 years of implementation. Under this framework contract, these international student and alumni networks will benefit from administrative, organisational, logistical, communication and technical support services, legal, accounting and linguistic services, as well as content development and structured feedback on EU educational mobility programmes and their impact. This project brings together European Union funded exchange students and alumni from any education and training sector through support to the Erasmus+ Student and Alumni Alliance (ESAA) and regional alumni associations, in particular the Western Balkans Alumni Association (WBAA) and the African Student and Alumni Forum (ASAF). <br> Doc Title: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks <br> Contract Type: Services. Published Date: 2023-09-27. Closing Date: 2023-09-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN EDUCATION AND CULTURE EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EACEA), EACEA.A.4.001 - INTERNATIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING
output.Summary: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks
output.Description: The object of this call for tenders is to support to the International Erasmus+ Alumni networks under the format of a framework contract with an indicative total budget of maximum EUR 15 000 000 for 4 years of implementation. Under this framework contract, these international student and alumni networks will benefit from administrative, organisational, logistical, communication and technical support services, legal, accounting and linguistic services, as well as content development and structured feedback on EU educational mobility programmes and their impact. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: DIGITAL INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY COMPANY OF THE FRENCH COMMUNITY. Summary: E-Learning Platform. Description: ETNIC wishes to acquire licenses allowing access to a catalog of online training and learning for all of its employees. The desired catalog must offer e-learning modules in the form of videos in different areas (IT, finances, soft skills, etc.) with an particularly well-stocked catalog in the IT field. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR MIGRATION AND HOME AFFAIRS (HOME), HOME.E.4 - UNION ACTIONS AND PROCUREMENT. Summary: Eu Knowledge Hub on Prevention of Radicalisation. Description: The European Commission is setting up an EU Knowledge Hub to strengthen the EU policy to prevent and counter radicalisation leading to violent extremism and terrorism. It will be steered by the Commission and will support Member States and other stakeholders in preventing and countering radicalisation. Its main objectives will be to consolidate and disseminate knowledge and expertise as well as to support Member States in developing strategies and practices in this field. It will also foster the implementation of prevention measures at national, European and international level by bringing together policy makers and practitioners - with the support of researchers - working on prevention and consolidating further their efforts. It will build on the Radicalisation Awareness Network (RAN) by smoothly transitioning from awareness raising towards consolidating knowledge including preventing radicalisation online, based on the lessons learnt and experience gathered by the RAN. <br> Doc Title: EU Knowledge Hub on Prevention of Radicalisation <br> Contract Type: Services. Tender Value: 60000000.00. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2023-09-08. Closing Date: 2023-11-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR MIGRATION AND HOME AFFAIRS (HOME), HOME.E.4 - UNION ACTIONS AND PROCUREMENT
output.Summary: Eu Knowledge Hub on Prevention of Radicalisation
output.Description: The European Commission is setting up an EU Knowledge Hub to strengthen the EU policy to prevent and counter radicalisation leading to violent extremism and terrorism. It will be steered by the Commission and will support Member States and other stakeholders in preventing and countering radicalisation. Its main objectives will be to consolidate and disseminate knowledge and expertise as well as to support Member States in developing strategies and practices in this field. It will also foster the implementation of prevention measures at national, European and international level by bringing together policy makers and practitioners - with the support of researchers - working on prevention and consolidating further their efforts. It will build on the Radicalisation Awareness Network (RAN) by smoothly transitioning from awareness raising towards consolidating knowledge including preventing radicalisation online, based on the lessons learnt and experience gathered by the RAN. <br> Doc Title: EU Knowledge Hub on Prevention of Radicalisation <br> Contract Type: Services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN EDUCATION AND CULTURE EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EACEA), EACEA.A.4.001 - INTERNATIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING. Summary: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks. Description: The object of this call for tenders is to support to the International Erasmus+ Alumni networks under the format of a framework contract with an indicative total budget of maximum EUR 15 000 000 for 4 years of implementation. Under this framework contract, these international student and alumni networks will benefit from administrative, organisational, logistical, communication and technical support services, legal, accounting and linguistic services, as well as content development and structured feedback on EU educational mobility programmes and their impact. This project brings together European Union funded exchange students and alumni from any education and training sector through support to the Erasmus+ Student and Alumni Alliance (ESAA) and regional alumni associations, in particular the Western Balkans Alumni Association (WBAA) and the African Student and Alumni Forum (ASAF). <br> Doc Title: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks <br> Contract Type: Services. Published Date: 2023-08-30. Closing Date: 2023-09-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

Summary: Support Services Related to Quality Assurance in Vocational Education and Training (Eqavet), Graduate Tracking and European Vocational Core Profiles (Evcp). Description: The overall objective of the call is to purchase the services of a contractor to provide a set of support services for the implementation of the 2020 Council Recommendation on VET, in particular the implementation of the EQAVET framework with a specific focus on graduate tracking, supporting the principle that VET should be flexible and modularised. The Commission is responsible for the coordination of the overall implementation of the objectives defined in the relevant Council Recommendations. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN EDUCATION AND CULTURE EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EACEA), EACEA.A.4.001 - INTERNATIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING. Summary: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks. Description: The object of this call for tenders is to support to the International Erasmus+ Alumni networks under the format of a framework contract with an indicative total budget of maximum EUR 15 000 000 for 4 years of implementation. Under this framework contract, these international student and alumni networks will benefit from administrative, organisational, logistical, communication and technical support services, legal, accounting and linguistic services, as well as content development and structured feedback on EU educational mobility programmes and their impact. This project brings together European Union funded exchange students and alumni from any education and training sector through support to the Erasmus+ Student and Alumni Alliance (ESAA) and regional alumni associations, in particular the Western Balkans Alumni Association (WBAA) and the African Student and Alumni Forum (ASAF). <br> Doc Title: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks <br> Contract Type: Services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA), HADEA.A.2.003 - PROCUREMENT. Summary: Hadea/2023/Op/0032-Pin - Building Capacity and Knowledge for the Implementation of the Eu Health Technology Assessment Regulation. Description: Through this procedure the contracting authority is seeking to purchase training services in the field of Health Technology Assessment (HTA), to ensure HTA agencies consolidate their knowledge and experience on joint HTA work. This purchase of services comes in a timely matter as the new HTA Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2021/2282) will enter into force in January 2025. The trainings requested will be of different nature, with online classes, recorded modules and tutoring. The topics have been pre-identified by the contracting authority but could be amended based on the actual needs of the HTA agencies and will serve the purpose of further strengthening the understanding of the new HTA regulations and its provisions. The topic is part of the EU4Health annual work programme 2023. <br> Doc Title: HADEA/2023/OP/0032-PIN - Building Capacity and Knowledge for the Implementation of the EU Health Technology Assessment Regulation <br> Contract Type: Services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA), HADEA.A.2.003 - PROCUREMENT. Summary: Hadea/2023/Op/0025 - Pin Myhealth @ Eu Infrastructure: Organisation and Implementation of Training Activities on the Legal Framework, Deployment, Functioning and Future Development. Description: The purpose of the call is to: 1. prepare, plan and structure the training programmes and materials on the legal framework, deployment, functioning and evolvement of MyHealth @ EU infrastructure, which is the cross-border digital infrastructure for the exchange of health data. The two categories of training programmes and materials are: • foundation level; • practitioner level. The training programmes will consist of both theory and practice through workshops and case studies; 2. execute trainings on foundation and practitioner levels; 3. prepare and provide the eLearning materials. The training programmes and materials, and eLearning materials are essential tools to improve knowledge-transfer and raise awareness on MyHealth @ EU, as well as to promote a harmonised approach to the deployment and operation of National Contact Points for eHealth (NCPeH). <br> Doc Title: HADEA/2023/OP/0025 - PIN MyHealth @ EU Infrastructure: Organisation and Implementation of Training Activities on the Legal Framework, Deployment, Functioning and Future Development <br> Contract Type: Services. output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN HEALTH AND DIGITAL EXECUTIVE AGENCY (HADEA), HADEA.A.2.003 - PROCUREMENT

output.Description: The purpose of the call is to: 1. prepare, plan and structure the training programmes and materials on the legal framework, deployment, functioning and evolvement of MyHealth @ EU infrastructure, which is the cross-border digital infrastructure for the exchange of health data. The two categories of training programmes and materials are: • foundation level; • practitioner level. The training programmes will consist of both theory and practice through workshops and case studies; 2. execute trainings on foundation and practitioner levels; 3. prepare and provide the eLearning materials. The training programmes and materials, and eLearning materials are essential tools to improve knowledge-transfer and raise awareness on MyHealth @ EU, as well as to promote a harmonised approach to the deployment and operation of National Contact Points for eHealth (NCPeH). <br> Doc Title: HADEA/2023/OP/0025 - PIN MyHealth @ EU Infrastructure: Organisation and Implementation of Training Activities on the Legal Framework, Deployment, Functioning and Future Development <br> Contract Type: Services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR MIGRATION AND HOME AFFAIRS (HOME), HOME.D.3 - PREVENTION OF RADICALISATION. Summary: Eu Knowledge Hub on Prevention of Radicalisation. Description: The European Commission is setting up an EU Knowledge Hub to strengthen the EU policy to prevent and counter radicalisation leading to violent extremism and terrorism. The EU Knowledge Hub will be steered by the Commission and its main task will be to support Member States and other stakeholders in preventing and countering radicalisation. Its main objectives will be to consolidate and disseminate knowledge and expertise as well as to support Member States in developing strategies and practices in this field. It will also foster the implementation of prevention measures at national, European and international level by bringing together policy makers and practitioners - with the support of researchers- working on prevention and consolidating further their efforts. It will build on the Radicalisation Awareness Network (RAN) launched by the Commission in 2011. <br> Doc Title: EU Knowledge Hub on Prevention of Radicalisation <br> Contract Type: Services. Description: Supply of training and support services to the Directorate-General for European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (ECHO) The general objective of the framework contract is to improve ECHO partners, staff and others' compliance with ECHO rules, procedures and policies. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN EDUCATION AND CULTURE EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EACEA), EACEA.A.4 - INTERNATIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING. Summary: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks. Description: Call for tender will be launched to support to the International Erasmus+ Alumni networks under the format of a framework contract with an indicative total budget of maximum EUR 15 000 000 for 4 years of implementation. Under this framework contract, these international student and alumni networks will benefit from administrative, organisational, logistical, communication and technical support services, legal, accounting and linguistic services, as well as content development and structured feedback on EU educational mobility programmes and their impact. This project brings together European Union funded exchange students and alumni from any education and training sector through support to the Erasmus+ Student and Alumni Alliance (ESAA) and regional alumni associations, in particular the Western Balkans Alumni Association (WBAA) and the African Student and Alumni Forum (ASAF). <br> Doc Title: Call for Tenders for Provision of Services for Erasmus+ International Students and Alumni Networks <br> Contract Type: Services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA). Summary: Big Public Buyers Collaboration Network for Strategic Public Procurement - Big Buyer 3. Description: The main objective of this call for tender is to improve the business environment of innovative SMEs and make public procurement an attractive option for these economic operators through an enhanced uptake of strategic public procurement in Europe. Such uptake is achieved through partnership between big public buyers such as cities, regions, hospitals, central purchasing bodies, or utilities working on concrete projects and similar challenges. This objective is achieved by promoting collaboration between big buyers in strategic public procurement with a view to driving the market for innovative goods, services and works. This also aims at contributing to the economic recovery of the EU, stimulating innovation and start-ups. The activities carried out in this project should be fully consistent with the overarching aims of the Green Deal, and any strategy related to a green, digital and resilient recovery. <br> Doc Title: Big Public Buyers Collaboration Network for Strategic Public Procurement - Big Buyer 3 <br> Contract Type: Services. Varied, accessible training tools and formats should adapt to learners- availability and diversity, making better use of new technologies to reach a wider audience. The strategy includes the requirement to make more use of ‘capsule- (short, up-to-date, tightly focused) e-training to addressing immediate needs in the context of a concrete case. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF SOCIALIST MUTUALITIES. Summary: Online Leercatalogus. Description: Document Type: Contract Notice <br> Title: online learning catalog <br> Reference number: NVSM-2022-025-NVSM-OO-F02_0 <br> Contract type: Supplies <br> Estimated Value: 270000.00 - EUR <br> Description: The Coronapandemie has ensured that employees have discovered the benefits of distance works. Employees do not want to move around anymore, not even for a course. As an organization, we would like to focus more on blended learning trajectories. The combination of online learning and face-to-face increases the chance that employees will apply what they have learned. For some learning needs, no face-to-face moment is not even needed and employees have collected sufficient knowledge in online learning. Online learning therefore wins at great importance in our organization. We want to offer employees the opportunity to work on their development where and when they want. <br> We have the knowledge and skills to make e-learning ourselves, but this is a time investment that we cannot afford for a large amount of e-learning. Hence we are looking for an external partner who offers us the opportunity to be able to purchase e-learning for certain themes. †. Tender Value: 270000.00. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2022-05-30. Closing Date: 2022-06-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF SOCIALIST MUTUALITIES
output.Summary: Online Leercatalogus
output.Description: Document Type: Contract Notice <br> Title: online learning catalog <br> Reference number: NVSM-2022-025-NVSM-OO-F02_0 <br> Contract type: Supplies <br> Estimated Value: 270000.00 - EUR <br> Description: The Coronapandemie has ensured that employees have discovered the benefits of distance works. Employees do not want to move around anymore, not even for a course. As an organization, we would like to focus more on blended learning trajectories. The combination of online learning and face-to-face increases the chance that employees will apply what they have learned. For some learning needs, no face-to-face moment is not even needed and employees have collected sufficient knowledge in online learning. Online learning therefore wins at great importance in our organization. We want to offer employees the opportunity to work on their development where and when they want. <br> We have the knowledge and skills to make e-learning ourselves, but this is a time investment that we cannot afford for a large amount of e-learning. Hence we are looking for an external partner who offers us the opportunity to be able to purchase e-learning for certain themes. †

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR BUDGET (BUDG). Summary: Procurement Procedure for the Development and Delivery of a Specialised Training Programme on the Integration of the Gender Equality Perspective into the Eu Budget. Description: Document Type : Prior information notice without call for competition <br> Title : Procurement Procedure for the Development and Delivery of a Specialised Training Programme on the Integration of the Gender Equality Perspective into the EU Budget <br> Reference Number : 2022/S 018-042406 <br> Contract Type : Services <br> Description : The objective is to develop and deliver a specialised training programme for Commission staff on how to integrate the gender equality perspective into the EU budget (gender budgeting). In particular, the training programme shall equip the target audience with the necessary theoretical and applied knowledge to recognize relevant gender equality angles in EU policy initiatives, conduct gender analysis as well as to identify the data, objectives and indicators necessary to integrate such a gender equality perspective in the performance framework of the EU budget. <br> • Each training round will consist of two (2) sessions, taking place in two (2) consecutive weeks (three hours + four hours, respectively); <br> • In 2022 a maximum of five (5) training rounds will be held whereas in the next four consecutive years, two training rounds will be provided annually. <br> <br> 80500000 - Training services <br> Authority Type : European Institution/Agency or International Organisation <br> Type of Procedure : Not applicable <br> Regulation : European Institution/Agency or International Organisation <br> Bid Type : Not applicable <br> Doc Title : Procurement Procedure ....
